power.中释: 借影响有权势人物以操纵权力的
power.英释: clothes which you wear at work to make you look important or confident

price.英释: to decide the price of something that is for sale

court.中释: 招致（失败、危险等）；向…献殷勤；设法获得

limit.英释: to stop an amount or number from increasing beyond a particular point

issue.中释: 发行，发布；发给；放出，排出
issue.英释: if an organization or someone in an official position issues something such as documents or equipment, they give these things to people who need them

offer.中释: 提议；出价；意图；录取通知书
offer.英释: a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

smell.英释: the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

share.英释: one of the equal parts into which the  ownership  of a company is divided

class.中释: 极好的；很好的，优秀的，出色的

slave.英释: to work very hard with little time to rest

brain.英释: to hit someone very hard on the head – used humorously

union.英释: an organization formed by workers to protect their rights

adult.英释: a fully-grown person, or one who is considered to be legally responsible for their actions

infer.英释: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

cover.中释: 封面，封皮；盖子；掩蔽物;幌子，借口
cover.英释: the outer front or back part of a magazine, book etc

sense.英释: if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

board.中释: 上（飞机、车、船等）；用板盖上；给提供膳宿
board.英释: to get on a bus, plane, train etc in order to travel somewhere

moral.英释: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

score.中释: 获得；评价；划线，刻划；把…记下
score.英释: to win a point in a sport, game, competition, or test

plant.英释: to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

speak.英释: to use your voice to produce words

agree.中释: 同意，赞成；承认；约定，商定
agree.英释: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

order.英释: to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

apply.英释: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something

carry.英释: the distance a ball or bullet travels after it has been thrown, hit, or fired

focus.英释: to give special attention to one particular person or thing, or to make people do this

sleep.英释: the natural state of resting your mind and body, usually at night

drink.英释: an amount of liquid that you drink, or the act of drinking something

visit.英释: to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest

trade.英释: to buy and sell goods, services etc as your job or business

track.中释: 追踪；通过；循路而行；用纤拉
track.英释: to search for a person or animal by following the marks they leave behind them on the ground, their smell etc

stand.英释: a position or opinion that you state firmly and publicly

force.英释: to make someone do something they do not want to do

range.中释: （在内）变动；平行，列为一行；延伸；漫游；射程达到
range.英释: to move around in an area without aiming for a particular place

extra.中释: 额外的，另外收费的；特大的
extra.英释: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number

usual.英释: happening, done, or existing most of the time or in most situations

guide.英释: to take someone to a place

exist.中释: 存在；生存；生活；继续存在
exist.英释: to happen or be present in a particular situation or place

smoke.英释: to suck or breathe in smoke from a cigarette, pipe etc or to do this regularly as a habit

prove.英释: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

store.英释: to put things away and keep them until you need them

doubt.英释: to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely

avoid.英释: to prevent something bad from happening

stock.英释: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell

draft.中释: 初步画出或（写出）的；（设计、草图、提纲或版本）正在起草中的，草拟的；以草稿形式的；草图的
draft.英释: a piece of writing that is not yet in its finished form

unite.英释: if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something

scale.英释: to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

trust.英释: to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

worth.英释: an amount of something worth ten pounds, $500 etc

month.英释: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

stick.英释: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose

refer.英释: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

short.英释: to almost do something but then decide not to do it

match.中释: 比赛，竞赛；匹配；对手；火柴
match.英释: an organized sports event between two teams or people

drive.中释: 驱动器；驾车；[心理] 内驱力，推进力；快车道

fight.英释: a situation in which two people or groups hit, push etc each other

ready.英释: to make something or someone ready for something

trace.中释: 痕迹，踪迹；微量；[仪] 迹线；缰绳
trace.英释: a small sign that shows that someone or something was present or existed

staff.英释: to be or provide the workers for an organization

judge.英释: the official in control of a court, who decides how criminals should be punished

grape.中释: 葡萄；葡萄酒；葡萄树；葡萄色
grape.英释: one of a number of small round green or purple fruits that grow together on a  vine . Grapes are often used for making wine

blame.英释: responsibility for a mistake or for something bad

truth.英释: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed

birth.英释: the time when a baby comes out of its mother’s body

topic.中释: 主题（等于theme）；题目；一般规则；总论
topic.英释: a subject that people talk or write about

ideal.英释: a principle about what is morally right or a perfect standard that you hope to achieve

basis.中释: 基础；底部；主要成分；基本原则或原理
basis.英释: the facts, ideas, or things from which something can be developed

brand.英释: a type of product made by a particular company, that has a particular name or design

goods.中释: 商品；动产；合意的人；真本领
goods.英释: things that are produced in order to be sold

prior.中释: (Prior)人名；(法、西、葡、捷)普里奥尔；(英)普赖尔；(意)普廖尔

print.中释: 印刷；打印；刊载；用印刷体写；在…印花样
print.英释: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc

imply.英释: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

actor.英释: someone who performs in a play or film

lobby.英释: to try to persuade the government or someone with political power that a law or situation should be changed

smile.英释: an expression in which your mouth curves upwards, when you are being friendly or are happy or amused

elite.英释: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

quote.英释: a sentence or phrase from a book, speech etc which you repeat in a speech or piece of writing because it is interesting or amusing

exert.英释: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

adopt.中释: 采取；接受；收养；正式通过
adopt.英释: to take someone else’s child into your home and legally become its parent

south.英释: in the south, or facing the south

shape.中释: 形成；塑造，使成形；使符合
shape.英释: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way

alike.英释: used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

royal.英释: a member of a royal family

scene.英释: a view of a place as you see it, or as it appears in a picture

cheer.中释: 欢呼；愉快；心情；令人愉快的事
cheer.英释: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement

voice.英释: to tell people your opinions or feelings about a particular subject

trait.英释: a particular quality in someone’s character

rapid.中释: 急流；高速交通工具，高速交通网

evade.英释: to not do or deal with something that you should do

alter.中释: (Alter)人名；(英)奥尔特；(德、捷、葡、爱沙、立陶、拉脱、俄、西、罗、瑞典)阿尔特

youth.中释: 青年；青春；年轻；青少年时期
youth.英释: the period of time when someone is young, especially the period when someone is a teenager

style.英释: to design clothing, furniture, or the shape of someone’s hair in a particular way

quest.英释: If you are questing for something, you are searching for it

solve.英释: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

shift.英释: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one

tempt.中释: 诱惑；引起；冒…的风险；使感兴趣
tempt.英释: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

boost.英释: something that gives someone more confidence, or that helps something increase, improve, or become successful

laugh.英释: to make sounds with your voice, usually while you are smiling, because you think something is funny

fruit.英释: if a tree or a plant fruits, it produces fruit

quick.英释: quickly – many teachers think this is not correct English

local.中释: 当地的；局部的；地方性的；乡土的
local.英释: relating to the particular area you live in, or the area you are talking about

relax.中释: 放松，休息；松懈，松弛；变从容；休养
relax.英释: to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

array.英释: to arrange something in an attractive way

equal.中释: 对手；匹敌；同辈；相等的事物
equal.英释: someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do

admit.英释: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

total.英释: the final number or amount of things, people etc when everything has been counted

taste.英释: to experience or recognize the taste of food or drink

count.英释: the process of counting, or the total that you get when you count things

reply.英释: something that is said, written, or done as a way of replying

brown.英释: the colour of earth, wood, or coffee

cheat.英释: someone who is dishonest and cheats

spare.英释: an additional thing, for example a key, that you keep so that it is available

toxic.英释: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

paint.中释: 油漆；颜料，涂料；绘画作品；胭脂等化妆品；色彩，装饰
paint.英释: a liquid that you put on a surface, using a brush to make the surface a particular colour

delay.中释: 延期；耽搁；被耽搁或推迟的时间
delay.英释: when someone or something has to wait, or the length of the waiting time

react.中释: 反应；影响；反抗；起反作用
react.英释: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

guess.英释: an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

beard.英释: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks

prize.英释: good enough to win a prize or having won a prize

clock.英释: to measure or record the time or speed that someone or something is travelling at

pride.英释: to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have

grasp.英释: to completely understand a fact or an idea, especially a complicated one

pupil.中释: 学生；[解剖] 瞳孔；未成年人
pupil.英释: someone who is being taught, especially a child

panic.英释: to suddenly feel so frightened that you cannot think clearly or behave sensibly, or to make someone do this

radio.英释: to send a message using a radio

award.英释: something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

ahead.中释: 向前地；领先地；在（某人或某事物的）前面；预先；在将来，为未来
ahead.英释: a short distance in front of someone or something

alert.英释: a warning to be ready for possible danger

treat.英释: something special that you give someone or do for them because you know they will enjoy it

crown.中释: 加冕；居…之顶；表彰；使圆满完成
crown.英释: to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen

super.中释: 特级品，特大号；临时雇员

noise.英释: if news or information is noised abroad, people are talking about it

bible.英释: TheBible is the holy book on which the Jewish and Christian religions are based

yield.英释: the amount of profits, crops etc that something produces

final.中释: 决赛；期末考试；当日报纸的末版
final.英释: the last and most important game, race, or set of games in a competition

cruel.中释: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的
cruel.英释: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

craft.英释: to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

spell.英释: a piece of magic that someone does, or the special words or ceremonies used in doing it

slice.中释: 切下；把…分成部分；将…切成薄片
slice.英释: to cut meat, bread, vegetables etc into thin flat pieces

march.中释: 行进，前进；行军；游行示威；进行曲
march.英释: an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something

watch.英释: a small clock that you wear on your wrist or keep in your pocket

faith.英释: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

mouth.中释: 做作地说，装腔作势地说；喃喃地说出

valid.中释: 有效的；有根据的；合法的；正当的
valid.英释: a valid ticket, document, or agreement is legally or officially acceptable

plead.英释: to give a particular excuse for your actions

chair.中释: 担任（会议的）主席；使…入座；使就任要职
chair.英释: to be the  chairperson  of a meeting or committee

chain.英释: to fasten someone or something to something else using a chain, especially in order to prevent them from escaping or being stolen

index.英释: if documents, information etc are indexed, an index is made for them

unity.英释: when a group of people or countries agree or are joined together

recur.中释: 复发；重现；采用；再来；循环；递归
recur.英释: if a number or numbers after a  decimal point  recur, they are repeated for ever in the same order

rally.英释: a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

clean.英释: a process in which you clean something

spark.英释: If a burning object or electricity sparks a fire, it causes a fire

thumb.英释: the part of your hand that is shaped like a thick short finger and helps you to hold things

purse.英释: if you purse your lips, you bring them together tightly into a small circle, especially to show disapproval or doubt

bound.英释: a long or high jump made with a lot of energy

steer.英释: a young male cow whose sex organs have been removed

pilot.英释: to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

block.中释: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

swing.中释: 旋转的；悬挂的；强节奏爵士音乐的

strip.英释: a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc

tower.英释: to be much taller than the people or things around you

organ.中释: [生物] 器官；机构；风琴；管风琴；嗓音
organ.英释: an organization that is part of, or works for, a larger organization or group

river.英释: a natural and continuous flow of water in a long line across a country into the sea

cliff.英释: a large area of rock or a mountain with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or a river

route.英释: a way from one place to another

cling.英释: If someone clings to a position or a possession they have, they do everything they can to keep it even though this may be very difficult

climb.英释: a process in which you move up towards a place, especially while using a lot of effort

alive.中释: 活着的；活泼的；有生气的

vivid.英释: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

punch.英释: to hit someone or something hard with your  fist (= closed hand )

dress.英释: a piece of clothing worn by a woman or girl that covers the top of her body and part or all of her legs

penny.英释: a British unit of money or coin used until 1971. There were 12 pennies in one  shilling

ferry.中释: （乘渡船）渡过；用渡船运送；空运
ferry.英释: to carry people or things a short distance from one place to another in a boat or other vehicle

lodge.英释: to make a formal or official complaint, protest etc

solid.英释: a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

tense.英释: any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

amuse.中释: 娱乐；消遣；使发笑；使愉快
amuse.英释: to make time pass in an enjoyable way, so that you do not get bored

stake.中释: 资助，支持；系…于桩上；把…押下打赌
stake.英释: to risk losing something that is valuable or important to you on the result of something

swamp.中释: 使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境
swamp.英释: If something swamps a place or object, it fills it with water

stain.英释: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

grave.英释: to cut, carve, sculpt, or engrave

prime.英释: to prepare someone for a situation so that they know what to do

cloud.中释: 使混乱；以云遮敝；使忧郁；玷污

pants.英释: a piece of clothing that covers you from your waist to your feet and has a separate part for each leg

float.中释: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
float.英释: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

robot.中释: 机器人；遥控设备，自动机械；机械般工作的人
robot.英释: a machine that can move and do some of the work of a person, and is usually controlled by a computer

phone.英释: to speak to someone by telephone

suite.中释: （一套）家具；套房；组曲；（一批）随员，随从
suite.英释: a set of rooms, especially expensive ones in a hotel

bonus.英释: money added to someone’s wages, especially as a reward for good work

adapt.英释: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

floor.中释: 铺地板；打倒，击倒；（被困难）难倒
floor.英释: to hit someone so hard that they fall down

booth.英释: A booth is a small area separated from a larger public area by screens or thin walls where, for example, people can make a telephone call or vote in private

tired.中释: 疲倦；对…腻烦（tire的过去分词形式）

crowd.英释: if people crowd somewhere, they gather together in large numbers, filling a particular place

fancy.英释: to like or want something, or want to do something

elect.英释: to choose someone for an official position by voting

groan.英释: a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do something

alarm.英释: If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

jeans.英释: trousers made of denim(= a strong, usually blue, cotton cloth )

naive.英释: not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen

merit.英释: to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

probe.英释: to ask questions in order to find things out, especially things that other people do not want you to know

coast.英释: the area where the land meets the sea

forge.英释: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real

opera.英释: a musical play in which all of the words are sung

dwell.英释: to live in a particular place

phase.英释: one of a fixed number of changes in the appearance of the Moon or a  planet  when it is seen from the Earth

speed.中释: 速度，速率；迅速，快速；昌盛，繁荣
speed.英释: the rate at which something moves or travels

forum.中释: 论坛，讨论会；法庭；公开讨论的广场
forum.英释: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

shell.中释: 剥落；设定命令行解释器的位置
shell.英释: to remove something such as beans or nuts from a shell or  pod

shelf.中释: 架子；搁板；搁板状物；暗礁
shelf.英释: a long flat narrow board attached to a wall or in a frame or cupboard, used for putting things on

mount.中释: 山峰；底座；乘骑用马；攀，登；运载工具；底座
mount.英释: used as part of the name of a mountain

snack.英释: to eat small amounts of food between main meals or instead of a meal

seize.英释: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

waste.英释: waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed

embed.中释: 栽种；使嵌入，使插入；使深留脑中
embed.英释: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

surge.英释: if a feeling surges or surges up, you begin to feel it very strongly

incur.英释: if you incur a cost, debt, or a fine, you have to pay money because of something you have done

april.英释: April is the fourth month of the year in the Western calendar

shoot.英释: an occasion when someone takes photographs or makes a film

depth.英释: the part that is furthest away from people, and most difficult to reach

toast.英释: to drink a glass of wine etc to thank some-one, wish someone luck, or celebrate something

repel.中释: 击退；抵制；使厌恶；使不愉快
repel.英释: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

hedge.中释: 对冲，套期保值；树篱；障碍
hedge.英释: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

slope.英释: if the ground or a surface slopes, it is higher at one end than the other

erupt.英释: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

basin.英释: a round container attached to the wall in a bathroom, where you wash your hands and face

guilt.英释: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong

verge.英释: the edge of a road, path etc

weary.英释: to become very tired, or make someone very tired

brass.中释: 黄铜；黄铜制品；铜管乐器；厚脸皮
brass.英释: a very hard bright yellow metal that is a mixture of  copper  and  zinc

flush.中释: 大量的；齐平的；丰足的，洋溢的；挥霍的
flush.英释: if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat

peace.英释: a situation in which there is no war or fighting

whirl.中释: 旋转，回旋；急走；头晕眼花
whirl.英释: to turn or spin around very quickly, or to make someone or something do this

scent.中释: 闻到；发觉；使充满…的气味；循着遗臭追踪
scent.英释: if an animal scents another animal or a person, it knows that they are near because it can smell them

weave.英释: the way in which a material is woven, and the pattern formed by this

whale.英释: a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

shave.中释: 刮脸，剃胡子；修面；<口>侥幸逃过，幸免；剃刀，刮刀
shave.英释: if a man has a shave, he cuts off the hair on his face close to his skin using a  razor

joint.中释: 连接，贴合；接合；使有接头

decay.中释: 衰退，[核] 衰减；腐烂，腐朽
decay.英释: the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

chess.英释: a game for two players, who move their playing pieces according to particular rules across a special board to try to trap their opponent’s  king (= most important piece )

chest.英释: the front part of your body between your neck and your stomach

tease.中释: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩
tease.英释: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way

naked.中释: 裸体的；无装饰的；无证据的；直率的
naked.英释: not wearing any clothes or not covered by clothes

sugar.英释: to add sugar or cover something with sugar

medal.英释: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

acute.中释: 严重的，[医] 急性的；敏锐的；激烈的；尖声的
acute.英释: an acute problem is very serious

drill.英释: to train soldiers to march or perform other military actions

mercy.中释: 仁慈，宽容；怜悯；幸运；善行
mercy.英释: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

reign.英释: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

giant.英释: extremely big, and much bigger than other things of the same type

bathe.英释: when you swim in the sea, a river, or a lake

hoist.英释: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

spicy.中释: 辛辣的；香的，多香料的；下流的
spicy.英释: food that is spicy has a pleasantly strong taste, and gives you a pleasant burning feeling in your mouth

cheek.中释: 无礼地向…讲话，对…大胆无礼
cheek.英释: to speak rudely or with disrespect to someone, especially to someone older such as your teacher or parents

dwarf.英释: a dwarf plant or animal is much smaller than the usual size

virus.英释: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

noisy.英释: someone or something that is noisy makes a lot of noise

skirt.英释: to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

skate.英释: one of a pair of boots with metal blades on the bottom, for moving quickly on ice

audio.中释: 声音的；[声] 音频的，[声] 声频的
audio.英释: relating to sound that is recorded or broadcast

audit.英释: an official examination of a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct

scorn.英释: to show that you think that something is stupid, unreasonable, or not worth accepting

glide.英释: a smooth quiet movement that seems to take no effort

avail.中释: 有益于，有益于；使对某人有利。
avail.英释: If you avail yourself of an offer or an opportunity, you accept the offer or make use of the opportunity

scout.英释: to examine a place or area in order to get information about it

stern.英释: serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

lever.中释: 用杠杆撬动；把…作为杠杆
lever.英释: to move something with a lever

stuff.英释: to push or put something into a small space, especially in a quick careless way

awful.中释: 可怕的；极坏的；使人敬畏的
awful.英释: making you feel great respect or fear

erect.中释: 竖立的；笔直的；因性刺激而勃起的

salad.英释: a mixture of raw vegetables, especially  lettuce  ,  cucumber  , and tomato

album.中释: 相簿；唱片集；集邮簿；签名纪念册
album.英释: a book that you put photographs, stamps etc in

bribe.英释: money or a gift that you illegally give someone to persuade them to do something for you

pearl.英释: to set with or as if with pearls

elder.中释: 年长的；年龄较大的；资格老的
elder.英释: Theelderof two people is the one who was born first

bride.英释: a woman at the time she gets married or just after she is married

blind.英释: to make someone lose their good sense or judgment and be unable to see the truth about something

sword.英释: a weapon with a long pointed blade and a handle

quart.中释: 夸脱（容量单位）；一夸脱的容器
quart.英释: a unit for measuring liquid, equal to two pints. In Britain this is 1.14 litres, and in the US it is 0.95 litres.

kneel.英释: to be in or move into a position where your body is resting on your knees

tiger.英释: a large wild animal that has yellow and black lines on its body and is a member of the cat family

steak.英释: good quality  beef  , or a large thick piece of any good quality red meat

crisp.英释: a very thin flat round piece of potato that is cooked in oil and eaten cold

ankle.英释: the joint between your foot and your leg

renew.中释: 使更新；续借；续费；复兴；重申
renew.英释: to begin doing something again after a period of not doing it

eagle.英释: a very large strong bird with a beak like a hook that eats small animals, birds etc

clasp.英释: to hold someone or something tightly, closing your fingers or arms around them

hatch.英释: if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

clash.中释: 冲突，抵触；砰地相碰撞，发出铿锵声
clash.英释: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports

brake.英释: a piece of equipment that makes a vehicle go more slowly or stop

steel.中释: 钢制的；钢铁业的；坚强的

ruler.中释: 尺；统治者；[测] 划线板，划线的人
ruler.英释: someone such as a king or queen who has official power over a country or area

entry.中释: 进入；入口；条目；登记；报关手续；对土地的侵占
entry.英释: the act of going into something

bacon.英释: salted or smoked meat from the back or sides of a pig, often served in narrow thin pieces

grind.英释: a movement in  skateboarding  or  rollerblading  , which involves moving sideways along the edge of something, so that the bar connecting the wheels of the  skateboard  or  rollerblade  presses hard against the edge

razor.英释: a tool with a sharp blade, used to remove hair from your skin

crude.英释: oil that is in its natural condition, as it comes out of an  oil well  , before it is made more pure or separated into different products

pulse.英释: to move or flow with a steady quickbeat or sound

ozone.英释: a poisonous blue gas that is a type of oxygen

onion.英释: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or white skin and many layers. Onions have a strong taste and smell.

blend.英释: a product such as tea, tobacco, or  whisky  that is a mixture of several different types

spoon.英释: to move food with a spoon

exact.英释: to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

cycle.英释: to go through a series of related events again and again, or to make something do this

bloom.英释: if a plant or a flower blooms, its flowers appear or open

crane.英释: If you crane your neck or head, you stretch your neck in a particular direction in order to see or hear something better

thorn.英释: a sharp point that grows on the stem of a plant such as a rose

wedge.中释: 楔子；楔形物；导致分裂的东西
wedge.英释: a piece of wood, metal etc that has one thick edge and one pointed edge and is used especially for keeping a door open or for splitting wood

strap.英释: a narrow band of strong material that is used to fasten, hang, or hold onto something

grief.英释: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

crash.中释: 摔碎；坠落；发出隆隆声；(金融企业等)破产
crash.英释: to make a sudden loud noise

evoke.英释: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

crush.中释: 粉碎；迷恋；压榨；拥挤的人群
crush.英释: a crowd of people pressed so close together that it is difficult for them to move

quilt.中释: 东拼西凑地编；加软衬料后缝制

candy.中释: 新潮的（服饰）；甜言蜜语的

fifty.中释: 五十的；五十个的；众多的

aisle.英释: a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theatre etc, or between rows of shelves in a shop

hobby.英释: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

exile.英释: to force someone to leave their country, especially for political reasons

lemon.英释: a fruit with a hard yellow skin and sour juice

hurry.中释: 仓促（做某事）；催促；（朝某方向）迅速移动；迅速处理
hurry.英释: to make someone do something more quickly

pitch.中释: 沥青；音高；程度；树脂；倾斜；投掷；球场
pitch.英释: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

erase.英释: to remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape

eject.英释: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

towel.英释: to dry yourself using a towel

ghost.中释: 作祟于；替…捉刀；为人代笔
ghost.英释: to write something as a  ghost writer

storm.中释: 起风暴；横冲直撞；狂怒咆哮
storm.英释: to shout something in an angry way

magic.中释: 不可思议的；有魔力的；魔术的
magic.英释: in stories, a magic word or object has special powers that make the person using it able to do impossible things

paste.中释: 面团，膏；糊状物，[胶粘] 浆糊
paste.英释: a soft thick mixture that can easily be shaped or spread

shrug.英释: a movement of your shoulders upwards and then downwards again that you make to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

sheep.英释: a farm animal that is kept for its wool and its meat

wreck.英释: to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

stoop.英释: if you have a stoop, your shoulders are bent forward

stone.英释: to throw stones at someone or something

drain.中释: 排水；下水道，排水管；消耗
drain.英释: a pipe that carries water or waste liquids away

boast.中释: 自夸；值得夸耀的事物，引以为荣的事物
boast.英释: something that you like telling people because you are proud of it

waist.英释: the narrow part in the middle of the human body

urban.中释: (Urban)人名；(西)乌尔万；(斯洛伐)乌尔班；(德、俄、罗、匈、塞、波、捷、瑞典、意)乌尔班；(英)厄本；(法)于尔邦

metre.英释: the basic unit for measuring length in the  metric system

idiom.英释: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

realm.英释: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

feast.英释: a large meal where a lot of people celebrate a special occasion

idiot.英释: a stupid person or someone who has done something stupid

tramp.中释: 流浪者；沉重的脚步声；徒步旅行
tramp.英释: someone who has no home or job and moves from place to place, often asking for food or money

melon.中释: 瓜；甜瓜；大肚子；圆鼓鼓像瓜似的东西
melon.英释: a large round fruit with sweet juicy flesh

porch.英释: an entrance covered by a roof outside the front door of a house or church

crawl.英释: an enclosure in shallow, coastal water for fish, lobsters, etc

trail.中释: 小径；痕迹；尾部；踪迹；一串，一系列
trail.英释: a rough path across countryside or through a forest

lover.英释: someone’s lover is the person they are having a sexual relationship with but who they are not married to

drift.英释: to move slowly on water or in the air

agony.中释: 苦恼；极大的痛苦；临死的挣扎

expel.英释: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization

smash.中释: 了不起的；非常轰动的；出色的

devil.中释: 虐待，折磨；（用扯碎机）扯碎；（替作家，律师等）做助手；抹辣味料烤制或煎煮

shear.英释: A pair of shears is a garden tool like a very large pair of scissors. Shears are used especially for cutting hedges.

grace.英释: to make a place or an object look more attractive

grade.英释: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is

slide.中释: 滑动；滑落；不知不觉陷入
slide.英释: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way

frost.英释: very cold weather, when water freezes

input.中释: [自][电子] 输入；将…输入电脑
input.英释: If you input information into a computer, you feed it in, for example, by typing it on a keyboard

bunch.英释: to pull material together tightly in folds

relay.中释: [电] 继电器；接替，接替人员；驿马

spear.英释: to push or throw a spear into something, especially in order to kill it

mayor.英释: the person who has been elected to lead the government of a town or city

frown.英释: the expression on your face when you move your  eyebrows  together because you are angry, unhappy, or confused

bosom.英释: A bosom buddy is a friend who you know very well and like very much

gauge.英释: to measure or calculate something by using a particular instrument or method

trick.中释: 特技的；欺诈的；有决窍的
trick.英释: when a photograph or picture has been changed so that it looks different from what was really there

comic.中释: 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物
comic.英释: a magazine for children that tells a story using comic strips

rigid.中释: 严格的；僵硬的，死板的；坚硬的；精确的
rigid.英释: rigid methods, systems etc are very strict and difficult to change

tribe.英释: a social group consisting of people of the same  race  who have the same beliefs, customs, language etc, and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader

excel.英释: to do something very well, or much better than most people

hinge.中释: 用铰链连接；依…为转移；给…安装铰链；（门等）装有蝶铰
hinge.英释: to attach something, using a hinge

lorry.中释: （英）卡车；[车辆] 货车；运料车
lorry.英释: a large vehicle for carrying heavy goods

label.英释: a piece of paper or another material that is attached to something and gives information about it

rural.中释: 农村的，乡下的；田园的，有乡村风味的
rural.英释: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

layer.中释: 把…分层堆放；借助压条法；生根繁殖；将（头发）剪成不同层次
layer.英释: to make a layer of something or put something down in layers

appal.英释: to make someone feel very shocked and upset

dense.英释: made of or containing a lot of things or people that are very close together

honey.中释: 对…说甜言蜜语；加蜜使甜

dairy.中释: 乳品的；牛奶的；牛奶制的；产乳的
dairy.英释: Dairy is used to refer to foods such as butter and cheese that are made from milk

cigar.英释: a thick tube-shaped thing that people smoke, and which is made from tobacco leaves that have been rolled up

patch.英释: to repair a hole in something by putting a piece of something else over it

apple.中释: 苹果，苹果树，苹果似的东西；[美俚]炸弹，手榴弹，（棒球的）球；[美俚]人，家伙。
apple.英释: a hard round fruit that has red, light green, or yellow skin and is white inside

chaos.英释: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

chase.英释: the act of following someone or something quickly in order to catch them

chart.中释: 绘制…的图表；在海图上标出；详细计划；记录；记述；跟踪（进展或发展
chart.英释: to record information about a situation or set of events over a period of time, in order to see how it changes or develops

tutor.英释: someone who gives private lessons to one student or a small group, and is paid directly by them

dirty.英释: To dirty something means to cause it to become dirty

mourn.英释: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

chill.中释: 冷冻，冷藏；使寒心；使感到冷
chill.英释: if you chill something such as food or drink, or if it chills, it becomes very cold but does not freeze

litre.中释: [计量] 公升（米制容量单位）
litre.英释: the basic unit for measuring liquid in the metric system

stare.英释: when you look at something for a long time in a steady way

blush.英释: the red colour on your face that appears when you are embarrassed

beach.英释: to pull a boat onto the shore away from the water

quota.英释: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

thief.英释: someone who steals things from another person or place

bleak.中释: 阴冷的；荒凉的，无遮蔽的；黯淡的，无希望的；冷酷的；单调的
bleak.英释: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

clone.英释: to make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially

graze.英释: a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

screw.英释: a thin pointed piece of metal that you push and turn in order to fasten pieces of metal or wood together

thigh.英释: the top part of your leg, between your knee and your  hip

stair.英释: a set of steps built for going from one level of a building to another

unify.英释: if you unify two or more parts or things, or if they unify, they are combined to make a single unit

breed.英释: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm

stall.英释: if an engine or vehicle stalls, or if you stall it, it stops because there is not enough power or speed to keep it going

negro.英释: relating to or characteristic of Negroes

pause.英释: to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again

sting.英释: if an insect or a plant stings you, it makes a very small hole in your skin and you feel a sharp pain because of a poisonous substance

cough.英释: to suddenly push air out of your throat with a short sound, often repeatedly

stalk.英释: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps

pound.英释: If you pound something, you crush it into a paste or a powder or into very small pieces

throw.英释: an action in which someone throws something

stamp.中释: 铭记；标出；盖章于…；贴邮票于…；用脚踩踏
stamp.英释: to put your foot down onto the ground loudly and with a lot of force

roast.英释: a large piece of roasted meat

knife.英释: to put a knife into someone’s body

niece.英释: the daughter of your brother or sister, or the daughter of your wife’s or husband’s brother or sister

stack.英释: If you stack a number of things, you arrange them in neat piles

mould.英释: a hollow container that you pour a liquid or soft substance into, so that when it becomes solid, it takes the shape of the container

heave.中释: 举起；起伏；投掷；一阵呕吐
heave.英释: a strong rising or falling movement

swarm.英释: a large group of insects, especially  bee s  ,moving together

avert.英释: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

bleed.英释: to force someone to pay an unreasonable amount of money over a period of time

arrow.中释: 以箭头指示；箭一般地飞向

juice.英释: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this

wheel.中释: 转动；使变换方向；给…装轮子
wheel.英释: to push something that has wheels somewhere

belly.英释: to fill with air and become rounder in shape

lapse.英释: A lapse of something such as concentration or judgment is a temporary lack of that thing, which can often cause you to make a mistake

angle.英释: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

queue.英释: to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere

angry.中释: 生气的；愤怒的；狂暴的；（伤口等）发炎的
angry.英释: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc

flare.中释: 加剧，恶化；底部展开；（鼻孔）张开的意思；闪光，闪耀；耀斑；爆发；照明弹

cargo.英释: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

snake.英释: if a river, road, train, or line snakes somewhere, it moves in long twisting curves

silly.英释: used to tell someone that you think they are not behaving sensibly

clerk.中释: 当销售员，当店员；当职员

alloy.英释: a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together

wheat.英释: the grain that bread is made from, or the plant that it grows on

liner.英释: a piece of material used inside something, especially in order to keep it clean

queer.中释: 同性恋者；怪人；伪造的货币
queer.英释: an offensive word for a homosexual person, especially a man. Do not use this word.

nerve.英释: to force yourself to be brave enough to do something

ditch.英释: a long narrow hole dug at the side of a field, road etc to hold or remove unwanted water

vital.中释: (Vital)人名；(法、德、意、俄、葡)维塔尔；(西)比塔尔

cream.中释: 奶油，乳脂；精华；面霜；乳酪
cream.英释: a thick yellow-white liquid that rises to the top of milk

orbit.英释: to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

blaze.中释: 火焰，烈火；光辉；情感爆发

creep.中释: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

shore.英释: the land along the edge of a large area of water such as an ocean or lake

green.英释: to fill an area with growing plants in order to make it more attractive

nylon.中释: 尼龙，[纺] 聚酰胺纤维；尼龙袜
nylon.英释: a strong artificial material that is used to make plastics, clothes, rope etc

flood.英释: a very large amount of water that covers an area that is usually dry

liver.英释: a large organ in your body that produces bile and cleans your blood

motel.英释: a hotel for people who are travelling by car, where you can park your car outside your room

shout.英释: a loud call expressing anger, pain, excitement etc

panda.英释: a large black and white animal that looks like a bear and lives in the mountains of China

blade.英释: the flat cutting part of a tool or weapon

sniff.中释: 吸，闻；嗤之以鼻；气味；以鼻吸气；吸气声

sweat.英释: drops of salty liquid that come out through your skin when you are hot, frightened, ill, or doing exercise

drunk.英释: unable to control your behaviour, speech etc because you have drunk too much alcohol

oxide.英释: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen

sweep.英释: the act of cleaning a room with a long-handled brush

hound.英释: a dog that is fast and has a good sense of smell, used for hunting

usage.英释: the way that words are used in a language

scrap.英释: Scrap metal or paper is no longer wanted for its original purpose, but may have some other use

jolly.中释: (Jolly)人名；(法)若利；(英、印)乔利；(德)约利

aloud.英释: if you read, laugh, say something etc aloud, you read etc so that people can hear you

radar.中释: [雷达] 雷达，无线电探测器
radar.英释: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

skull.英释: the bones of a person’s or animal’s head

nurse.英释: someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital

blast.英释: to criticize someone or something very strongly – used especially in news reports

choke.中释: 窒息；噎；[动力] 阻气门
choke.英释: a piece of equipment in a vehicle that controls the amount of air going into the engine, and that is used to help the engine start

ratio.英释: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

endow.英释: You say that someone is endowed with a particular desirable ability, characteristic, or possession when they have it by chance or by birth

burst.英释: the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst

lease.英释: to use a building, car etc under a lease

ounce.英释: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 28.35 grams. There are 16 ounces in a pound.

elbow.英释: to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them

repay.英释: to pay back money that you have borrowed

laser.英释: a piece of equipment that produces a powerful narrow beam of light that can be used in medical operations, to cut metals, or to make patterns of light for entertainment

fraud.英释: the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

spill.中释: 溢出，溅出；溢出量；摔下；小塞子
spill.英释: when you spill something, or an amount of something that is spilled

spine.英释: the row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your  spinal cord

pedal.英释: of or relating to the foot or feet

widow.英释: a woman whose husband has died and who has not married again

inlet.中释: 引进; 嵌入; 插入;

width.英释: the distance from one side of something to the other

humid.中释: 潮湿的；湿润的；多湿气的
humid.英释: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

flour.英释: to cover a surface with flour when you are cooking

equip.英释: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

shake.英释: if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

tempo.英释: the speed at which music is played or should be played

shine.中释: 光亮，光泽；好天气；擦亮；晴天；擦皮鞋；鬼把戏或诡计
shine.英释: the brightness that something has when light shines on it

fence.中释: 防护；用篱笆围住；练习剑术
fence.英释: to fight with a long thin sword as a sport

diary.英释: a book in which you write down the things that happen to you each day

spray.英释: to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

shirt.英释: a piece of clothing that covers the upper part of your body and your arms, usually has a collar, and is fastened at the front by buttons

epoch.中释: [地质] 世；新纪元；新时代；时间上的一点

party.英释: If you party, you enjoy yourself doing things such as going out to parties, drinking, dancing, and talking to people.

value.中释: 尊重，重视；给…估价，给…估值
value.英释: to think that someone or something is important

level.英释: flat and not sloping in any direction

March.英释: the third month of the year, between February and April

agent.英释: a person or company that represents another person or company, especially in business

event.英释: something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual

allow.英释: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

apart.英释: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other

aside.英释: words spoken by an actor to the people watching a play, that the other characters in the play do not hear

money.英释: what you earn by working and can use to buy things. Money can be in the form of notes and coins or cheques, and can be kept in a bank

motor.英释: the part of a machine that makes it work or move, by changing power, especially electrical power, into movement

great.英释: very large in amount or degree

among.中释: 在一群(组)之中；在…之中，于…之间
among.英释: with a particular group of people

video.英释: relating to or used in the process of recording and showing pictures on television

grant.英释: an amount of money given to someone, especially by the government, for a particular purpose

below.英释: in a lower place or position, or on a lower level
